xxl.core.predicates
Class Predicates

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.predicates.Predicates

public class Predicates
extends Object

This class provides static methods for the straightforward creation of predicates.

The implemented predicate methods create predicates that can be used for the comparision of objects. The desired predicate can be specified by a binary operator and a comparator. As binary operators the String objects == (or =), !=, <, <=, > and >= can be used. When a comparator is specified, it will be used for comparing the given objects.

See Also:
Equal, Greater, GreaterEqual, Less, LessEqual, NotEqual

Method Detail

predicate

public static Predicate<Object> predicate(String op)
Returns a binary predicate that realizes the given binary operator. The factory method accepts the following binary operators and returns the following predicates:
operator predicate
== or = Equal
!= NotEqual
< Less
<= LessEqual
> Greater
>= GreaterEqual

Parameters:
op - the operator that should be implemented by the predicate (== or =, !=, <, <=, >, >=).
Returns:
a binary predicate that implements the specified operator.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid operator is specified.

predicate

public static <P> Predicate<P> predicate(String op,
                                         Comparator<? super P> comparator)
Returns a binary predicate that realizes the given binary operator. The specified comparator is used for object comparision. The factory method accepts the following binary operators and returns the following predicates:
operator predicate
== or = Equal
!= NotEqual
< Less
<= LessEqual
> Greater
>= GreaterEqual

Type Parameters:
P - the type of the predicate's parameters.
Parameters:
op - the operator that should be implemented by the predicate (== or =, !=, <, <=, >, >=).
comparator - the comparator that should be used for object comparision.
Returns:
a binary predicate that implements the specified operator.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid operator is specified.

newNullSensitiveEqual

public static Predicate<Object> newNullSensitiveEqual(boolean flag)
Returns a predicate able to handle null values. The given flag controls whether two passed null values should be equal or not. Notice the difference in semantics when evaluating join predicates using the two different kinds of Equal-predicates returned by this method.

Parameters:
flag - controls whether two passed null values should be equal or not.
if true - null == null
if false - null != null
Returns:
the predicate able to handle null values.

newNullSensitivePredicate

public static <P> Predicate<P> newNullSensitivePredicate(Predicate<? super P> predicate,
                                                         boolean defaultValue)
Makes a given predicate able to handle null values. The defaultValue is the return value of the predicate if one of the parameters is a null value. If no null value is handed over the given predicate is called.

Type Parameters:
P - the type of the predicate's parameters.
Parameters:
predicate - the given predicate.
defaultValue - the default value.
Returns:
the predicate able to handle null values.

swapArguments

public static <P> Predicate<P> swapArguments(Predicate<? super P> predicate)
Returns a new predicate, which has the same invoke function with the given predicate, but the order of the arguments is swapped.

Type Parameters:
P - the type of the predicate's parameters.
Parameters:
predicate - the given predicate.
Returns:
the new predicate.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
